newsitem.title: GERMANY: Merck eyes 96 profit gain after sales jump.
newsitem.headline: Merck eyes 96 profit gain after sales jump.

text.p: German drugs and chemicals group Merck KGaA on Tuesday said it expected to post another significant rise in annual profits after reporting that group sales climbed 11.3 percent in 1996.

In a mandatory bourse statement the group said 1996 sales climbed to 6.98 billion marks from 6.3 billion marks in 1995 with pharmaceutical sales posting the single strongest gain, rising 16 percent to 3.9 billion marks.
In light of strong sales figures, the group said it expected to post "another significant rise in profits" during the period without being more specific.
At the beginning of 1996, Merck management board chairman Hans Joachim Langmann forecast the group would show a 30 to 40 percent profit hike from 1995's 355 million mark net profit.
